title: How to Prepare Potato Dextrose Agar (PDA) using Fresh Potatoes (Part 1/4)

tasks.task: Preparation and Use of Potata Dextrose Agar (PDA)
subtasks: Calculating ingredients for a specified volume (250ml) of PDA
Peeling and cutting fresh potatoes as per recipe
Measuring and weighing 5 grams of dextrose (sugar)
Measuring and weighing 5 grams of agar
Mixing the potato pieces in a container
Adding dextrose to the potato pieces
Adding agar to the mixture
Ensuring appropriate hydration for the agar
Placing the mixed ingredients into a suitable container for autoclaving
Using an autoclave (stereotactic incubator) to heat the mixture and sterilize it
Acknowledging viewers and thanking the assistant (Miss Aubrey)

tasks.task: Preparation and Use of Potata Dextrose Agar (PDA)
subtasks: Calculating the correct amounts of ingredients (250ml: 50g potatoes, 5g dextrose, 5g agar)
Peeling and cutting fresh potatoes according to the recipe
Measuring 5g of dextrose
Measuring 5g of agar
Mixing the potato pieces in a container
Adding 5g of dextrose to the potato pieces
Incorporating 5g of agar into the mixture
Ensuring proper hydration for the agar if using dehydrated form
Transferring the mixed ingredients into an autoclaveable container
Sterilizing the PDA mixture using an autoclave (e.g., at 121°C for 15 minutes)
Acknowledging viewers and thanking the assistant (Miss Aubrey)
